content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map. Multiple recovery attempts were made to deploy a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) – intended to receive Automation Science Packs for research – but none succeeded due to missing Lab items in the inventory. Although pre‐existing furnaces were referenced for smelting (an iron‐smelting furnace at (5.0, 5.0) and a copper‐smelting furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)), no structures were actively constructed by the agent in these steps.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Call Misuse for Entity Retrieval
  – Avoid passing unsupported keyword arguments (for example, remove “radius” if the API accepts only positional arguments).
  – Ensure the argument list matches the function signature; verify the number and type of parameters to prevent TypeErrors.
  – Check the return value of get_entities before using it (default to an empty list rather than iterating over a None value).

• Lab Placement and Crafting Failures
  – Verify that the required Lab item is available in the inventory prior to placement at (0.5, 2.5) to avoid placement errors.
  – Before attempting to craft a Lab, confirm that all intermediary sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables) are sufficiently available.
  – Establish a robust resource production pipeline (including proper smelting cycles for iron and copper plates) so that all sub-components for Lab crafting are obtainable.
  – Review fallback approaches when API calls do not return expected results; guard against performing operations on NoneType objects.
